entries.title: Wizards Of The Coast Announces Changes To Dungeons & Dragons Open Gaming License Rollout
entries.description: Wizards of the Coast likely expected the early part of this year to feature early hype about their upcoming Dungeons & Dragons movie Honor Among Thieves and discussion of their lineup of books for this year. Instead, a leak of proposed changes to the game have put the community up in arms.

entries.title: Snapdragon Satellite Allows You To Message From Around The World
entries.description: There's been an increasing interest in satellite communications with standard smartphones. At CES 2023, Qualcomm announced its Snapdragon Satellite world-wide satellite service for premium smartphones in the second half of 2023 utilizing the Iridium satellite constellation.

entries.title: Tenstorrent Shifts Leadership Roles
entries.description: The Toronto-based startup is growing, swapping CEO and CTO leadership roles, and laying out a compelling roadmap.

entries.title: See The New 10-Terabyte Image Of Our Galaxy That Reveals Over Three Billion New Celestial Objects
entries.description: Astronomers have released a gargantuan survey of the galactic plane of the Milky Way.

entries.title: Qualcomm Highlights Snapdragon Ride Flex SoC And The Best Concept Car At CES 2023
entries.description: #1-Ranked Industry Analyst Patrick Moorhead gives his coverage of Qualcomm and its Snapdragon Ride Flex family of SoCs at CES 2023.

entries.title: 4 Things To Consider Before Giving Someone A Second Chance
entries.description: A psychologist helps you determine when to accept an olive branch.

entries.title: Conversational AI Is Changing How We Deal With Data
entries.description: In the world of spreadsheets and data analysis, a new player has emerged to shake up the game: Akkio.

entries.title: ChatGPT In Schools: Here’s Where It’s Banned—And How It Could Potentially Help Students
entries.description: Seattle Public Schools is the latest district to announce their ban of ChatGPT from school devices.

entries.title: Steakholder Foods Machine Prints Cultivated Fish That You Can Eat
entries.description: It's like the magical replicator from Star Trek that could create meals on demand.

entries.title: Sky-High Used-Car Prices Are Finally Coming Back Down To Earth
entries.description: The Tesla Model 3 is the biggest loser in this regard, dropping in price by an average 16.8% in recent months.

entries.title: Walgreens Strikes $83 Million Settlement With West Virginia Over Opioid Crisis
entries.description: West Virginia—which has the nation’s highest overdose death rate—has already reached settlements with other pharmacies, including Rite Aid and CVS, in similar litigation.

entries.title: Greenland Ice Sheet Warmest In At Least 1,000 Years As Scientists Warn Melting Ice Will Accelerate Sea-Level Rise
entries.description: Greenland’s ice sheet could cause up to 20 inches of global sea-level rise by the end of the century, researchers warn.

entries.title: 16 Practical Ways To Ensure Companywide Teams Keep Their Software Up To Date
entries.description: From focused education efforts to automation to gamification and more, there are many options to increase awareness of the importance of software updates.

entries.title: Four Tasks For CEOs In 2023: Leveraging The Downturn
entries.description: In a tough economy, the genuine need for belt-tightening should not obscure the chance for start-up leaders to take specific steps to reset their companies so they are positioned to seize the advantage and emerge even stronger when growth resumes in 2024 or beyond.

entries.title: Career Advice From The Next CEOs, The Most In-Demand Freelance Skills And More
entries.description: The published version of this week’s Forbes Careers newsletter brings the latest news, commentary and ideas about the workplace, leadership, job hunting and the future of work straight to your inbox every Wednesday.

entries.title: “Rough Sleepers”— The Growing Problem Of Homelessness In America
entries.description: Homelessness is a wide-spread and growing problem even among those who are employed. Tracy Kidder gives us an intimate look at the problem through the eyes of Boston's Dr. Jim O'Connell.

entries.title: ServiceNow CFO Gina Mastantuono: The C-Suite Interview
entries.description: ServiceNow CFO Gina Mastantuono on the changing role of the CFO and developing the new skills needed to succeed as a leader.

entries.title: ‘Elden Ring’ Was The Second Best-Selling Video Game Of 2022
entries.description: Elden Ring was edged out of first place at the end of 2022.

entries.title: VDO Aims To Bring New Revenue To Publishers
entries.description: VDO says their AI technology is enabling platforms such as theirs so they can handle over 5 billion transactions daily each.

entries.title: AI 50: Submissions For Forbes’ 2023 List Of The Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Startups Are Now Open
entries.description: AI 50, Forbes’ data-driven determination of the most promising private artificial intelligence companies in the world, is back for a fifth year. Submissions are open through February 10.

entries.title: The Nintendo Switch And PlayStation 5 Dominated 2022
entries.description: Nintendo's console sold the most units. Sony's made the most money.

entries.title: Latest Problems Reported By Pixel 7 And Pixel 7 Pro Owners
entries.description: Pixel 7 and Pixel 7 Pro owners are facing another software problem with Google's latest smartphones.

entries.title: Number Of U.S. Uninsured Falls Once More [Infographic]
entries.description: Enrollment for coverage under the Affordable Care Act, also dubbed Obamacare, is up for the third year in a row, which is reflected in the rising number of Americans who have health insurance. Expansions to programs like Medicaid and the Affordable Care Act aided the process.

entries.title: NI – Getting Complex Products To Market Faster
entries.description: #1-Ranked Industry Analyst Patrick Moorhead dives in as recently the company, National Instruments, has reinvented its operating model to focus on software-defined testing systems and the addition of technologies such as data analytics and machine learning.

entries.title: Apple iOS 16.3: Apple Lets Slip Release Surprise For The Next iPhone Update
entries.description: Just a matter of days until the next big update for iPhones is released, and is timed with Black History Month. Which is much sooner than anyone expected.

entries.title: Lightspeed Names Industry Mogul To Lead $7 Billion Gaming Practice
entries.description: Leading venture capital firm Lightspeed has named Moritz Baier-Lentz as the head of its first-ever dedicated gaming team.

entries.title: Russia And Iran Eye Up Trade Using Cryptocurrencies To Avoid Dollars And Sanctions
entries.description: Russia and Iran are in talks over a plan to launch a new cryptocurrency backed by gold, which could be used in their bilateral trade deals.

entries.title: The Industrial Robot Paradox
entries.description: Robots are effectively used in mass production such as in the automotive and microelectronics industries. Their usage in other industries is still very limited, and there is a reason for this.

entries.title: Twitter’s Money Problems Deepen: Revenues Reportedly Plummet As Major Advertisers Jump Ship After Musk’s Takeover
entries.description: Ads accounted for around 90% of Twitter’s revenue in recent financial filings but many companies turned away from the platform after Musk took over.

entries.title: Moderna May Raise Covid-19 Vaccine Price Up To $130, Bernie Sanders Calls It ‘Outrageous’
entries.description: Pfizer may raise its Covid-19 mRNA vaccine prices four-fold as well

entries.title: Why Seniors Should Still Get Their Covid-19 Booster
entries.description: We all need to play a role—from families to community leaders to health care professionals to policymakers—to ensure the protection of our nation’s seniors from this ever-changing virus.

entries.title: How A Company’s Philosophy To “Shift Left” Is Making Headway In The Data Privacy World.
entries.description: While data privacy continues to propagate daily headlines from breaches to new laws, many in the business world are wrestling with how to design a vigorous and thoughtful privacy program without bogging down the necessary speed of the software development life cycle.

entries.title: Understanding The Cellular Agriculture Industry’s Impact And Growth
entries.description: Just like the pioneering technologies that preceded it, cellular agriculture has a high chance to grow exponentially in the next decade.

entries.title: A Psychologist Offers 3 Tips To Tackle Decision Paralysis
entries.description: Making big decisions is usually about getting the little things right.

entries.description: Hogwarts Legacy has just released a new cinematic trailer that acts as a sort of tour of the locations and enemies of the game.

entries.title: The FBI's Source Of Trust Just Got Hacked
entries.description: Successful attacks may not happen all that often, but that doesn’t mean the threats aren’t there. In fact, there are millions of attempted attacks—both physical and cyber—against the country’s CI each year.

entries.title: Apple HomePod 2: Stunning, If Familiar, New $299 Speaker Confirmed In Surprise Reveal

entries.title: Technology Vs. Legislation: Which Will Save Web Accessibility?
entries.description: Although the incentives to use accessibility solutions and comply with the law are evident, we still need to consider whether it will be technology or legislation, or both, that will triumph in the fight for increased web accessibility, which should aim to close the gap once and for all.

entries.title: Don’t Miss Destiny 2’s Wild Lightning Motion Shader, No Iron Banner Grind Required
entries.description: I do not know what Destiny 2’s shader team has been drinking this year, but I want some. Something appears to have been unlocked within the tech of Destiny 2 to create shaders that are so cool in terms of texture and animation, they could almost be classified as exotic compared to past ones.

entries.title: Are Drones The Flying Personal Computers Of The 1980s?
entries.description: Further down the road—as drones fully come into their own as the PC and its permutations have—we may find ourselves pointing on a digital map and telling a mobile robotics device where exactly we want it to go and what exactly we want it to do.

entries.title: Sequoia Doubles Down On Seed Investing To Hunt For The Unicorns Unique To Downturns
entries.description: The Silicon Valley heavyweight has a new $195 million seed fund, and is increasing the number of accelerator-style programs it plans to run.

entries.title: The Consumerization Of Healthcare Can Only Go So Far
entries.description: Despite the enthusiasm and influx of new tech, a gap still exists between the vision for a digitized healthcare experience and substantive clinical benefits that could result from consumer technologies.

entries.title: ‘Attack On Titan’ Final Season Part 3 Gets A Release Date, New Trailer
entries.description: Here is the release date for Attack on Titan final season, season 4, Part 3.

entries.description: No-code platforms are quickly becoming a game-changer for businesses of all sizes.

entries.title: Representation Matters: DEI And The Underrepresentation Of Black Women In The Technology Sector
entries.description: As tech professionals, we are the ones who have the power to change this narrative so that the face of the industry isn’t singular. The first question to answer: How can we get more Black women to join the tech industry?

entries.title: The Last Of Us’ Critic And Audience Scores Are Nothing Short Of Miraculous
entries.description: I cannot get over just how well The Last of Us premiere went on HBO this past week. Yes, both to me personally as a fan of the original game, but more in general, in terms of how it’s being received by both the critic class and average viewers. The scores it’s racked up here are nothing short of...

entries.title: Netgear’s M6 Pro Is The Rolls-Royce Of Mobile Hotspot Routers
entries.description: Netgear's newest mobile hotspot router offers a super-fast 5G data connection and support for the latest Wi-Fi 6E band. It's ideal as a backup connection or even your only Internet connection as it can handle speeds up to 4Gbps.

entries.title: 16 Reasons DevSecOps Efforts Fail (And How To Get Them Right)
entries.description: Adopting DevSecOps isn’t a simple, single step; it requires new partnerships and processes backed by the full commitment of stakeholders.

entries.title: 3 Hot, 3 Not: E-Commerce Tech Trends In The Pipeline For 2023
entries.description: This year is going to be a transformative one for retailers and consumers alike as new tools and features will empower an even more customizable, seamless online shopping experience.

entries.title: A Sales Performance End-Of-Year Review
entries.description: 62% of revenue ops and sales ops leaders and professionals say they plan to intentionally increase their alignment between sales, marketing, and customer success in 2023.

entries.title: Does Exposing And Logging Those Generative AI ChatGPT Erroneous And Hallucinatory Outputs Do Any Good, Asks AI Ethics And AI Law
entries.description: Here are some examples of generative AI ChatGPT producing falsehoods in the outputted essays, which raises questions including whether we should be logging these. AI Ethics and AI Law issues arise.

entries.title: The ROI Of Workforce Empowerment
entries.description: Why is building more empowered teams a worthwhile initiative?

entries.title: ‘The Legend Of Vox Machina’ Cast Interview: Talking Season 2 With The Cast Of Amazon’s Best Fantasy Show
entries.description: The Legend Of Vox Machina returns for its second season this Friday. I had the great fortune of talking with the extremely talented cast, who not only star but executive produce the fantasy show. We discuss Season 2, adapting the show from the D&D campaign and much more.

entries.title: Three Red Flags PS5’s ‘Forspoken’ Has Raised Already
entries.description: Forspoken is a soon-to-be-released blockbuster title from Square Enix, one that represents a major console exclusive for PS5 in 2023. But I am starting to grow increasingly skeptical of this game, as every day feels like it’s bringing some new red flag.

entries.title: Why The Hoarder Mindset Is Limiting Data Value
entries.description: Heavy focus on maximizing input means department heads, and employees, at the end of the line, often find data is too chaotic and unreliable to apply well, even with advanced modern stacks in place.

entries.title: The New Paradigm For Platform M&A
entries.description: Many people conflate platforms and products, but platforms are different from products because they are two-sided marketplaces.

entries.title: Cybersecurity Trends To Look Out For In 2023
entries.description: The ever-changing nature of cybersecurity, combined with the high risk that comes with being poorly protected, inflicts the cybersecurity landscape with high-stakes uncertainty.

entries.title: How Boards Can Leverage ESG To Navigate Economic Uncertainty And Inflation
entries.description: “I see a lot of (leaders and board members) really wanting to understand the subject matters, really wanting to build resiliency into the system,” Helle Jorgenson, CEO of Competent Boards said. She delineated the many issues facing boards today & explored how ESG principles can help navigate them.

entries.title: Exploring The Untapped Potential Of Skill-Based Gaming
entries.description: In skill-based gaming, there is no element of chance or luck. It is a way to showcase real talent with the added adrenaline that comes with the potential to reap rewards for top performers.

entries.title: The Role Of Software In Facilitating The Electric Grid Of The Future
entries.description: To achieve a smarter, more resilient grid of the future, we must deploy technologies that can marry human preparation and ingenuity with the scale, speed and data processing power of software.

entries.title: ChatGPT And AI Will Fuel New EdTech Boom
entries.description: Venture capitalists predict artificial intelligence, virtual reality and video-learning startups will dominate the space in 2023.

entries.description: Making websites accessible for people with disabilities is a win-win scenario for web-based businesses and organizations.

entries.title: America’s Obsession With Alcohol- Will It Ever End?
entries.description: Alcohol use, even at moderate amounts, is linked to a number of medical and health-related issues; including but not limited to an increase risk of cancers such as liver, esophagus, and breast; an increased risk of heart disease, stroke, and high blood pressure.

entries.title: The Four Pillars Of Content Enablement
entries.description: Businesses urgently need to rethink the way they conceptualize and approach content if they want to thrive.

entries.title: GDPR Fines Reach Record Level
entries.description: European data regulators issued a record €2.92 billion in fines last year, up 168% on 2021, with Meta the hardest hit.

entries.title: How To Incorporate IT Staffing Within Your Organization
entries.description: Innovation and technology need to be in perfect synergy for them to truly grow and become a single unit.

entries.title: Why The Moon Is Suddenly Closer To Earth Than For 992 Years—And What It Means
entries.description: The upcoming New Moon is the ultimate "Supermoon—the closest the Moon has got to Earth in a period of 1337 years.

entries.title: Logitech’s Latest Brio 300 Series Webcams Make An Ideal Upgrade For Laptop Users
entries.description: If you are less than impressed with webcam built into your laptop, the new Logitech Brio 300 and 305 is a cost-effective way of improving your image on video meetings.

entries.title: Samsung Reveals Galaxy S23 Ultra’s Secret Weapon
entries.description: Samsung has announced a powerful new camera sensor that’s a perfect fit for the forthcoming Galaxy S23 Ultra.

entries.title: How To Deal With Cyberbullying At Work
entries.description: Workplace cyberbullying – via text message, email, or other electronic platforms – is now increasingly common. Use these tips to spot and combat workplace cyberbullying.

entries.description: How to solve today's Wordle.

entries.description: At 8.8 billion light-years away it's the first time this type of radio signal has been detected at such a large distance.
